snippet: FISHER--Jerome. The Fashion Footwear Association of New York (FFANY) mourns the loss of Jerome "Jack" Fisher, a legend in our industry and esteemed philanthropist. We extend our deepest condolences to his beloved wife Anne, to his son Marc, a dynamic member of FFANY's Board, and to the entire Fisher Family on the loss of their patriarch. Jack brought talent, tenacity, passion and a generous spirit to all his pursuits. He catapulted the footwear industry to new heights and was a respected benefactor of many health, education and arts organizations. Jack saved countless lives through his visionary founding and leadership of "FFANY Shoes on Sale" and generations to come will continue to benefit from its funding of innovative breast cancer detection and treatment. While our hearts are heavy with this loss, they are uplifted knowing Jack's legacy of compassion and strength lives on through his cherished family and will inspire us all to follow in his footsteps to bring our industry and community together for good works. Jim Issler, Chairman Ron Fromm, President & CEO Joe Moore & Dick Jacobson, Presidents Emeritus FFANY 1/3
